00018 class semaphore : private boost::noncopyable
00019 {
00020     int v;
00021     boost::mutex mutex;
00022     boost::condition cond;
00023 
00024 public:
00025     semaphore(int init_value = 1) : v(init_value)
00026     {
00027     }
00028     ~semaphore()
00029     {
00030     }
00031     // function increments the semaphore and signals any threads that
00032     // are blocked waiting a change in the semaphore
00033     int operator ++ (int)
00034     {
00035         boost::mutex::scoped_lock Lock(mutex);
00036         int res = ++v;
00037         Lock.unlock();
00038         cond.notify_one();
00039         return res;
00040     }
00041     // function decrements the semaphore and blocks if the semaphore is
00042     // <= 0 until another thread signals a change
00043     int operator -- (int)
00044     {
00045         boost::mutex::scoped_lock Lock(mutex);
00046         while (v <= 0)
00047             cond.wait(Lock);
00048 
00049         int res = --v;
00050         return res;
00051     }
00052     // function does NOT block but simply decrements the semaphore
00053     // should not be used instead of down -- only for programs where
00054     // multiple threads must up on a semaphore before another thread
00055     // can go down, i.e., allows programmer to set the semaphore to
00056     // a negative value prior to using it for synchronization.
00057     int decrement()
00058     {
00059         boost::mutex::scoped_lock Lock(mutex);
00060         return (--v);
00061     }
00062 };
